title: Price predictions 11/12: BTC, ETH, XRP, BNB, SOL, DOGE, ADA, HYPE, LINK, BCH
summary: Bitcoin bulls attempted to initiate a recovery, but were met with heavy selling pressure near $107,000. A similar fate awaited most altcoins, which sold off from their respective resistance levels.

title: Skittish risk managers could turn Bitcoin’s institutional boom into a bust, CEO warns
summary: Markus Thielen warns Bitcoin’s institutional rally could reverse as ETF outflows and market fatigue weigh on risk appetite.

title: Leap Therapeutics surges 170% after $50M Zcash buy with Winklevoss backing
summary: The biotech firm is shifting to a crypto-focused strategy, backed by Winklevoss Capital, and investing $50 million in the Zcash protocol's native token.

title: SEC chair pledges no ‘lax enforcement’ on crypto under market structure
summary: With market structure moving forward in the US Congress to establish clear roles for the SEC and CFTC over digital assets, Paul Atkins offered his thoughts on the bill.

title: Circle plans native token for Arc blockchain as Q3 profit surges
summary: The stablecoin issuer considered stablecoin-denominated gas fees on Arc, but has a long-term goal of shifting to distributed governance.

title: How Ripple plans to bridge crypto and Wall Street in its $4B expansion
summary: Ripple bundles custody, prime brokerage, treasury and stablecoins so institutions can operate like banks with crypto rails.

title: Bitcoin falls to $101K despite stocks, gold rallying ahead of vote to end US govt shutdown
summary: Bitcoin fell to new weekly lows at $101,300 as US equities and gold rallied ahead of the key vote to end the US government shutdown, signaling a shift in investor sentiment toward traditional assets.

title: Franklin Templeton expands Benji tokenization platform to Canton Network
summary: Franklin Templeton has linked its Benji tokenization platform to the Canton Network, expanding institutional access to regulated onchain assets.

title: Strategy’s Bitcoin dominance slips in October as corporate treasuries expand
summary: Michael Saylor’s company remains a top Bitcoin holder, but its dominance has fallen amid slower accumulation and rising competition.

title: Bitcoin price boom isn’t guaranteed after US shutdown: Here’s why
summary: The end of Trump's last US government shutdown back in 2019 saw a boom in crypto markets, but things are a bit different this time around.
